quote: I've never seen anything like that.
Hmm?
I've never seen anything like that.
The woman?
She was dead... the tricorder clearly    showed...
Ah yes, well tricorders... very    accurate with live people, not so    accurate with dead ones... we learn    that in the first year of medical    school...
Well, I was impressed, Doctor.
Hmmm.  And well you should be.
I impressed myself on this one    actually.  I can't imagine what other
I feel privileged to be in your    presence.
Glad to have you along.
Detecting a priority one broad band    distress signal.
Kobliad transport Reyab to any    ship.  Our central power linkage    has exploded.  We're losing life    support.  Please respond...
Just picking it up on long range    sensors.  Bearing three four seven    mark zero eight.
(pressing information     into panels, then     checking)   I'm reading massive energy leakage...    its aft structural integrity field    is failing...
This is the Federation Ship Rio    Grande.  We're on our way.
O-2 pressure dropping rapidly...    toxic gas levels rising... we have    no more than ten minutes breathing    time left in here...
Automatic fire suppression must be    off-line.  I'll check the central    power linkage...
Relax.  I'm a doctor...
What happened?
You lost consciousness.       We've got to evacuate your ship.     How many others are on board?
(struggling to maintain
I'm reading another lifeform...
No... don't open that...
It's sealed...
Prisoner... I'm transporting... he    started the fire... to escape...
He's dying.  Where's the manual    override...
No...
Don't...
He's... dangerous.
I assure you, in this condition,    he's no threat to anyone.

Power linkages are completely shot...    maneuvering subsystems are out...    I've managed to stabilize the    structural integrity field, but I    don't know how long that will last...    we'll have to tow it in...
His synaptic fields are dissipating...    I can't get a neural reading... I    have to get him to the emergency    unit in the Runabout.
Computer, four to transport...
...make... me... live...
This one I can't bring back.
Where am I?
You're on Station D.S. Nine... I'm    Doctor Bashir...
Ty Kajada... Kobliad Security...       D.S. Nine... but that's where he was    going...
Where is he?  Where is Vantika?
Your prisoner?  He's dead.
You're certain.
Yes.  You were the only survivor.
Where's his body?
I have it in stasis.
I want to see it.
Later, when you're feeling stronger...
Now.
The preliminary examination indicated    that the subject died of a massive    respiratory failure, brought on by    the pulmonary trauma suffered in the    fire.
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: Are you sure it's the same body?
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: (a little surprised     at the question)   Quite certain.  It's been sealed in    here ever since our arrival.
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: Have you run a retinal imaging scan?
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: What for... ?
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: To confirm there is no residual    activity in the visual cortex...
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: Miss Kajada, I assure you he is    dead...
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: He's faked his death more times than    I can tell you, Doctor.  The last    time someone thought he was dead,    they didn't live to regret the    mistake.
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: He was a murderer... ?
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: That description doesn't do justice    to the horrors he is responsible for    on my world.       He is quite brilliant in his way.  A    man of science.  Who killed others    to prolong his own life.  I've tracked    him for twenty years.
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: Please perform an autopsy.  I want    his identity confirmed with a DNA    reference scan.
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: Of course.
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: And have someone scan my ship to    make sure there are no anomalous    life forms on board...
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: Are you sure that's necessary?
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: Very sure.
scene: 9    INT. STASIS ROOM - A BODY CABINET (OPTICAL)

quote: Iced Raktajino.  Extra cream.
Thank you, Quark.
At your service.  Day or night.
Poor woman.  She's obviously    infatuated with me.
You're deluding yourself.
There's nothing wrong with a good    delusion.  I sell them upstairs to    dozens of people every day.       Besides, there's something in her    eyes when she looks at me.
An allergic reaction, no doubt.
I think she's lonely.
Dax?  She has ten lifetimes of friends    to call on before she calls you.     And every man on the station would    like to be buying her a Raktajino.
Ah, but I'm the one with the Raktajino    machine.
She seems to prefer to spend most of    her time alone... which I understand    perfectly.
Well, then that must make her the    perfect woman for you.
I wouldn't intrude on her privacy as    some would.
You're pathetic.  You think everyone    in the galaxy should be as lonely    and miserable as you are.

As hard as it may be for you to    understand, some of us like company.     The sound of a friendly voice.  The    sight of a familiar face.    (stares hungrily at     Dax)   The feel of smooth, pliant flesh.
Why do you bother?
It's good to want things.
Even things you can't have?
Especially things I can't have.
Like the Deuridium shipment?
(not a blink,     "innocent," new game)   Deuridium shipment.  Is there a    deuridium shipment coming here?
I'm watching you, Quark.
And I'm watching you, Jadzia.
Interesting technique.
Do you always get ready for an    important operation by leaking word    about it to the local black market?
The way I handle my business is none    of your concern.
I'm afraid it is.
scene: 15   INT. PROMENADE - CONTINUOUS - MOVING WITH THEM

quote: Lieutenant George Primmin.  Starfleet    security.
scene: 15   INT. PROMENADE - CONTINUOUS - MOVING WITH THEM

quote: If you don't mind, I'd like to talk    to you about the deuridium shipment    from the Gamma Quadrant.
scene: 15   INT. PROMENADE - CONTINUOUS - MOVING WITH THEM

quote: We have nothing to discuss.  Security    is already in place.
scene: 15   INT. PROMENADE - CONTINUOUS - MOVING WITH THEM

quote: I'd appreciate it if we could go    over it anyway.  It took me three    weeks to get here.  I'd hate to think    it was for nothing.
scene: 15   INT. PROMENADE - CONTINUOUS - MOVING WITH THEM

quote: If you insist.  Meet me in my office    at seventeen hundred hours.
scene: 15   INT. PROMENADE - CONTINUOUS - MOVING WITH THEM

quote: The autopsy revealed nothing out of    the ordinary.  Fingerprints, cerebral    cortex scan, and retinal patterns    all match up perfectly with the    records Kajada provided.  Vantika    may have faked his death before, but    I don't think he's faking this time.
Why was he coming here?
They're Kobliad.
(understands     immediately)   The deuridium.
I'm sorry... ?
The Kobliad is a dying race.  They    need deuridium to stabilize their    cell structure.  It prolongs their    lifespan...

The Federation's been working to    supply them with deuridium, but even    the new deposits from the Gamma    Quadrant won't be enough to service    the whole population.  It's so scarce,    some of the Kobliad have gone    underground to get it.
So he was coming here to hijack the    shipment.
Is Kajada satisfied with your autopsy?
I don't think anything's going to    convince her he's dead, Commander.
Vantika has been the focus of Kajada's    attention for most of her adult life.     In a way, they were as intimately    connected as any two people could    be.
Let's do her the courtesy of granting    her requests as long as they're not    too far out of line.  A quick sweep    of her ship isn't too much to ask.
I'm more concerned that he might    have had help waiting here to hijack    the shipment.
Mister Primmin, good.  In my office.     I need to brief you on an unusual    security issue that's been raised...
I'll get Odo up here...
Ah... that's okay, Major.  I'll fill    him in later on anything he needs to    know.
How are you getting on with Constable    Odo, Lieutenant?
I'm sure he's good at keeping order    down there on the Promenade...
But...

Frankly, isn't the security of a    deuridium shipment a little over his    head... I mean he was chatting about    it in the bar with that Ferengi    Quark... if I could overhear it, so    could half-dozen others...
It's hard to keep a secret in a place    like this, Lieutenant.  It's not a    starship...
I understand that, but...
I'm sure almost everyone knows about    the shipment by now.  Odo was probably    making sure Quark knows we know he    knows.
(too chummy for a     subordinate)   Well, it's not how we learned it at    the academy, is it, sir.  If you    want my opinion...

Actually, I don't.    (beat, off Primmin's     take)   You and I are guests of the Bajorans,    Lieutenant.  You don't have to forget    what you learned at the academy...    just don't throw it in anyone's face    here.  If you're really smart, you    might even learn a few new things    about station security from our    Constable.  Clear?
Very clear, sir.

Now, regarding the shipment, we've    been made aware of a possible Kobliad    plot to hijack the deuridium... you    and Odo ought to have a talk with    Kajada, the Kobliad security officer    who arrived yesterday...
Before we get started, I want to    apologize for us getting off on the    wrong foot.
Think nothing of it.
Listen, this is your bailiwick.  I    know that.  And I don't mean to be    throwing my weight around.  No hard    feelings.
None at all.
Just because I'm from Starfleet    Security doesn't mean I don't respect    your opinion.  How about showing me    what you've got and I'll see if    there's anything we can work with.
Lieutenant, you're welcome to see my    plans, but I assure you, I've taken    every precaution regarding the    shipment.
Of course, if you have any    suggestions, I'll be happy to hear    them.
What the...       Odo to Ops...
Go ahead.
Major, are we having some sort of    computer problem?
Everything in active memory has been    accessed and purged.
That's impossible.
Oh, it's possible.
Vantika did the exact same thing on    Rigel Seven.
I know Vantika.  I've learned to    think as he thinks...
Kajada, our best evidence suggests    Vantika stopped thinking two days    ago...

He's alive.  And he's on board this    station... and the minute he came on    board, his first thought was to plan    a way to access your security files    on the deuridium shipment... which    is exactly what he's done.
Even if he was alive, it doesn't    make sense that he would purge an    entire computer memory to go after a    single file...
It makes perfect sense.       Try to access the single file and    you'd be stopped by a dozen different    lock-outs that I put in to protect    it.
But you would never consider locking    out the active memory of your whole    system...
That would make it impossible to use    the computers at all...
So that's where you're vulnerable.
But how would he gain access?
(a beat, thinking as     Vantika)   In the past, he's used a subspace    shunt attached to a secondary system,    something that runs through the entire    facility but isn't covered by    security.
The lighting controls or maybe the    replicators.
I'm showing an unauthorized tap into    the computer system at a temperature    control panel... Level twenty-one.     Section ten.
Security to...
... to L-twenty-one, S-ten.  We're    looking for a subspace crossover    link to the computer system...
Acknowledged.
Tell them to be careful.  Vantika    undoubtably equipped the shunt with    an auto-destruct system.
(very curious about     this woman)   You know that for certain... without    even checking.
I know Vantika.
Miss Kajada, I have to admit I'm    having a tough time with your    theory...
Then you're making a fatal mistake.
There were three passengers on your    ship... two bodies are in our morgue.     Unless the ghost of Vantika is    wandering our halls...
Don't patronize me, Commander...
Isn't it more likely that some    accomplice did this?

Rao Vantika is obsessed with his own    survival.  He's prolonged his life    with drugs, cryogenics, transplants.     As a medical supervisor in a high    security penitentiary, he used    prisoners for illegal experiments in    cellular longevity.  He organized    raids on government labs to steal    bio-regenerative research.  I promise    you when he started that fire on my    ship, he had a plan to survive.  I    don't know what that plan was, but    I'm convinced it succeeded.
Doctor, how soon before we get the    results of the DNA trace?
I sent it to Starfleet Command    yesterday... they'll have to    coordinate with Kobliad security...    I'd guess another twelve hours.
Until then, we'll operate under the    assumption that Vantika's alive.
Commander... may I have a word with    you...
What's on your mind.
My resignation.
You're overreacting.
Oh, so you already know about this.
Lieutenant Primmin mentioned to me    that...
You asked me to stay in charge of    security when you took command of    this station... I didn't ask you...
Constable, no one knows this station    like you do...
Yes, I've noticed that.  "Constable."     Very cute.
It's an expression of affection... I    believe Major Kira was the first    to...
I don't need anyone's affection.  I    do need clear jurisdiction.  Or I'm    out.
I like you, Odo.  I like to know    where a man stands.  And there's    never any question of that with you.     I need you here.  No Starfleet officer    can do the job you do.
You've got that straight.
But you have to realize that Starfleet    is not going to take command of a    station in deep space without    assigning some security to protect    its interests.
Understandable.
You're going to have to work with    Primmin.  The two of you have to    find a way to get along.
Tell that to him.
I already have.
Who's in charge.
In joint operations like this one,    you are.
I can live with that arrangement.
What have you got, Dax?
Not exactly sure, yet.  I finished    the sweep of Kajada's ship... no    anomalous readings but I did notice    one odd thing...
What's that?
Somebody tried to break into the    ship's cargo bay.
Since it's been docked?
Kira confirmed that there was no    damage to the cargo area when they    brought it in.
What do you think they were after?
This, maybe...
I found it with Vantika's personal    belongings.
What the hell is it?
A map.  Of a humanoid brain.
You call this clean?

I've already found three coins on    the floor up here... who knows what    else there might be... somebody might    have lost some valuable jewelry or    something... fine, never mind, I'll    do it myself... and I'll keep it    myself.  Leave...
You just can't find good help any    more.
Have you made the preparations?
Preparations?  What preparations?
The deuridium shipment.  You were to    hire mercenaries to help me.
Help you...       But.  You can't be... Vantika...
I told you to expect me on this date.
Yes, and I contacted some very    reliable soldiers of fortune in    anticipation of your arrival... but    I was told you were dead...
Almost.  But not quite.
You wanted to see me?
Kajada.  Be right with you.
There, now remember, next time lift    with your back straight and use the    anti-gravity generator.
I'm sorry.  Come in.  I have the DNA    scan results.  I thought you might    want to see them.       In fact, I tried to contact you last    night, but you never responded to    the com.
I... I have trouble sleeping.  Last    night was... particularly bad... I    used an Alpha Wave inducer to help    me.
You should be careful with those.     They're only meant for occasional    use.
The scan results, Doctor.
There wasn't even a trace of diploid    variation.  It's definitely not a    clone.
Positive identification.  Rao Vantika.
They must have overlooked something.
Dax to Bashir.
Yes, Jadzia...
I need some medical advice... can    you come to my lab... ?
With wings on my heels.  Bashir out.       Every conceivable test has been done,    Kajada.
Here's the hypothesis... the body    dies... but the consciousness lives    on...
scene: 30   INT. LAB - CLOSE ON THE MONITOR (VPB)

quote: In another brain... ?
scene: 30   INT. LAB - CLOSE ON THE MONITOR (VPB)

quote: Possible?
scene: 30   INT. LAB - CLOSE ON THE MONITOR (VPB)

quote: The closest thing I've encountered    is synaptic pattern displacement.     But that's never been done by a non-   Vulcan.
scene: 30   INT. LAB - CLOSE ON THE MONITOR (VPB)

quote: I'm convinced Vantika was working on    it... there are over seventy different    computer simulations in his file...    all involve identifying neural energy    patterns and storing them in different    areas of the brain...
scene: 30   INT. LAB - CLOSE ON THE MONITOR (VPB)

quote: There'd be plenty of room... a    humanoid uses only a small portion    of the brain.
scene: 30   INT. LAB - CLOSE ON THE MONITOR (VPB)

quote: So what if another entity shared the    unused portion...
scene: 30   INT. LAB - CLOSE ON THE MONITOR (VPB)

quote: Hypothetically, Vantika's    consciousness could be occupying    someone else's brain while he waits    for the deuridium to arrive.  But    whose?
scene: 30   INT. LAB - CLOSE ON THE MONITOR (VPB)

quote: Kajada?
scene: 30   INT. LAB - CLOSE ON THE MONITOR (VPB)

quote: They're both Kobliad.  What better    place to hide than in the mind of    your worst enemy?
scene: 30   INT. LAB - CLOSE ON THE MONITOR (VPB)

quote: It doesn't make sense.  She's been    doing everything she can to convince    us Vantika is alive.  If Vantika's    controlling her, why would he call    attention to himself?
We're not suggesting he's controlling    her.
Look, this is all theoretical, but    to extend the logic, there's no reason    to believe she would even be aware    of his presence...
Like a stowaway on a ship... the    pilot is still at the helm, but    someone else is along for the ride.
Would an examination of Kajada confirm    any of this?
We don't know what we're looking for    yet.  We have to identify the method    of transfer first.
Even if Vantika could isolate the    patterns of chemical and electrical    interactions in his own brain, he'd    still need a way to move them from    one brain to another...
Kobliads don't have psychic abilities    like Vulcans, so we're assuming that    we're looking for a physical transfer    method of some kind.
If we can find it, that might give    us a way to flush him out of there.
I could assign some personnel to    maintain continuous surveillance on    Kajada...
We're already stretched to the limit    preparing for the shipment... why    don't I just set up the computer to    track her movements, alert us if she    goes near a secured area...
At the very least, she has to be    left out of our security plans...
She won't like that...
I'm afraid we have no choice.
What do we tell her?
Nothing.  She'll figure it out.  And    when she does, send her to me.
The computer security codes have    been changed... I've been denied    access... why?
Because I ordered it.
What kind of fool are you?
My own special variety.
I'm the only one here who has    experience with Vantika...
I'm sorry... I believe it's necessary    at this point to limit access to the    security files to four people --    myself, Lieutenant Primmin, Major    Kira and Commander Sisko.
When is the shipment scheduled to    arrive?
I can't give you that information.
(more frustrated,     another tack)   What about this Ferengi, Quark?
What about him?
From what I understand, he has his    hands into everything around here.     Is he under surveillance?
I always keep an eye on him.
I hope so.  Because he's exactly the    kind Vantika would use in his plans.
So when do we meet this Kobliad...
When he decides it's appropriate...
All right then, a better question --    when do we get paid...
When the job is completed of course...
Not acceptable.  We will require an    advance payment of seventy percent.
Durg.  Wake up.  This is Quark, you're    talking to.  Remember.
All past debts have been settled.
They'll never be settled.  You'd    still be rotting in a Cardassian    jail if I hadn't...
Can you speak... ?
Pushed.  Vantika.
I can't keep her conscious any    longer... if she moves around too    much, she could suffer permanent    paralysis...
Did you see anybody behind her?
I just heard the scream and looked    up... she fell from the balcony...    what was she doing up there anyway?
She had an odd feeling you might be    helping someone hijack this deuridium    shipment.
I resent the inference.
It's not an inference.  It's a    definite suspicion.
Was there anyone else in the bar?
Anyone else?
At the time of the accident.
No.  No.  Just me.  Just tidying up.     Which if you'll excuse me, I really    must finish...
Not so fast, Quark.  I want to take    a look at that third floor before    you get rid of all the evidence.
Be my guest.  I'm telling you she    was alone up there... and she had no    business invading the privacy of a    law-abiding member of the community...
What do you think, Doctor?  Could    this have been a suicide attempt?
I didn't notice any indication of    suicidal behavior... but who knows    what the effect of... sharing one's    brain might be?
I'd still like some confirmation of    that.
I'll have to tend to her injuries    before I can conduct any brain    scans... but until we identify the    transfer method Vantika used, I'm    not even sure what to look for.
(acknowledges, hits     his combadge)   Computer, location of Lieutenant    Dax.
Lieutenant Dax is in the stasis    room...
Find something under his fingernails?
Not yet.
What were you looking for?
Confirmation of a theory.  I hope.
I've been asking myself why anyone    would want to induct a bio-electrical    charge into a glial cell?
A question I've always wondered    about...

It might make sense if you wanted to    send a bio-coded message along the    glial cells of someone's nervous    system... all the way to the brain.     My guess is that's what Vantika was    trying to do...
Using his fingernails?
Frankly, I can't think of another    way he could have delivered the bio-
A microscopic generator.
You're suggesting he had his    consciousness stored in that thing?

His neural patterns encoded as bio-   electrical pulses.  He could have    placed that device under his nail    months ago... just in case he needed    an escape route in an emergency.     His last resort before death.
Will this show up in Kajada?
Now that we know what to look for,    we should be able to confirm it with    a glial scan.
Do it as soon as Bashir stabilizes    her condition.  Nice work.

Confirm that each distribution    amplifier is at one hundred percent    efficiency... if there's more than a    point-zero-three percent fall off,    replace it...       And that won't mean a thing if any    of the power waveguide outlets fail...    double-check them...
You better make this the final    check... we've only got an hour...       Where's Primmin?
I thought he was with you.
I sent him to help you with the final    security sweep of the docking area...
He hasn't been here all morning.
No, I won't be going with you... I    am simply a middleman... a    facilitator...
A profit monger...
And proud of it.
How did you get your hands on a    Federation Runabout, Quark?
I can take no credit for that.  Your    employer has somehow managed to    arrange security access...
When do we meet this "employer"?
His message said he would be waiting    for us on board.
Secured area, access to security    clearance seven and above.
Seven... seven... let me see... that    should be no problem...
I'm beginning to believe this Vantika    is invisible...
His funds are quite real... they    were transferred into my accounts    this morning... and will be waiting    for you upon your return...
Oh, I'm terribly sorry... we seem to    have made a wrong turn...
We didn't mean to disturb you, Doctor.
Not at all, gentlemen.  I've been    expecting you.
Julian?
Computer -- location of Doctor Bashir.
Doctor Bashir is in the Infirmary.
What the hell are you doing in there?     I told you to sweep the docking bay    again...
I took a cue from you...
From me?
You understood the logic of Vantika's    M-O when he downloaded the computer    memory -- avoid the single file and    attack the system...
I'm not following.

Vantika has to know that all of our    security efforts will be focused on    the docking ring.  I figured if he    holds true to form that's not where    he'd try to hurt us... so I ran a    diagnostic of all systems that could    shut our whole defense array down...
I already did that twice today...

I know.  I didn't find anything    either.  But then I went to the back-   up systems and I found a glitch there    I couldn't explain... so I tracked    it back to the waste reclamation    system... where no one would ever    think to look because it's considered    non-essential...
I found this.
Another subspace crossover shunt.     Just like the one Vantika used to    tap into the computer.
It was set to feedback into the    primary command and control    functions...
We would have been shut down for    close to an hour.
Long enough for him to grab the    freighter and warp it off to who-   knows-where...
Yes, Major?
The Norkova's just come through the    wormhole... requesting permission to    dock...
Let's go to security alert yellow...    what bay do you have assigned in the    plan...
Number eight.
Odo, maintain a visible contingent    of security at bay eight... but I'm    sending the Norkova to the second    back-up...       Bay twelve.
I'll send additional forces over to    twelve...
Commander, your Lieutenant Primmin    there just saved us all a lot of    problems...
Another subspace crossover that would    have crippled us long enough for    them to escape with your deuridium...
Odo, did you deploy a Runabout to    escort the Norkova...
No...
Then how come the Rio Grande's going    out to meet it...
On screen.
Benjamin, Julian's missing.
Missing...
His combadge was in the Infirmary.     I can't find him anywhere.
Computer, who authorized access to    Runabout Rio Grande?
Authorization access code four-one-   two-one.  Doctor Julian Bashir.
It's safe.
Shields up.
Done.
Secure the rest of the ship... be    sure to account for all twelve members    of the crew... if they resist, kill    them...       Enter the new course...
Aye...
The station has locked a tractor    beam on us...
That's not possible... they should    be shut down by now...
Well, they're not.  They're hailing    us...
Hailing us... ?
Engage engines, full impulse...
We're not going anywhere with a    tractor beam on us...
Do it!
Full impulse engaged.  The tractor    beam is holding.
But they won't be able to pull us    in.
We can't just sit here and wait.     What do you intend to do?
Open a channel.
This is Benjamin Sisko, Commander of    D.S. Nine.
Rao Vantika is my name.  But I assume    you know that by now.
I want to speak to Doctor Bashir.
Unfortunately, he's not available at    the moment.
Is he all right?
His body is... how do you humans say    it... "fit as a fiddle."  Looks rather    good on me, don't you think?
What have you done to his mind,    Vantika?
It was necessary to render him    unconscious for the time being.     However, I might consider leaving    his body and returning him to you.     But first you must release your    tractor beam.
I can't do that.
If you don't, I'll take this vessel    to warp.
The tractor beam would rip your ship    apart.  You and everyone else on    board would be killed.
Exactly.  So if you care at all about    the welfare of your Doctor, you will    release your hold on us.  You have    one minute to decide.
Can you get a Transporter lock on    him?
Suggestions... ?

A small ship like a Runabout might    be able to get close enough to    overload their shield generators    with directed phaser fire... we used    to do it to Cardassian freighters    all the time...
But you'd be risking a hull breach...    and with all the deuridium on board...

He's right... we can't risk releasing    deuridium into this system... every    populated area would have to be    evacuated...       Dax... is there any way to disrupt    Vantika's control over Bashir?

I have an exact model of Vantika's    neural energy patterns.  If I can    design an electromagnetic pulse to    disrupt those patterns, Julian might    emerge... But we still need a way to    get it there.
What if we send it right along the    tractor beam... at the same frequency    as their shields... ?
The pulse would resonate off the    shields... and create a reflected    EM field inside the ship...
He's hailing us...
I need some time...
I'll give you as much as I can.  On    screen.
Have you decided?
If I permit you to leave, what    guarantee do I have that you'll return    Bashir?
You're ready to capitulate far too    quickly, Commander.  Would you be    planning a rescue attempt, perhaps?
I'm only interested in my doctor's    safety.
You insult my intelligence.       Prepare to go to warp...
You've gone to great lengths to    survive, Vantika.  I don't think    you're ready to kill yourself.
And I don't think you're ready to    risk spreading deuridium all over    this system...
Ready to engage warp engines.
You must be crazy... I want no part    of...
No more middlemen, Sisko.  No more    delays.  What's it to be?
All right... we're prepared to release    the tractor beam...       Dax?
(scrambling with her     hands)   Ready.
Do it.
Doctor Bashir... answer me...    Bashir...
(struggling for     consciousness)   What... yes... ?
Doctor.  Lower the shields.
What?  What shields?  Where am...
I'll explain later.  Lower the    shields.  Now.
Nooooo...
Shields are down.
Get him out of there.
Energizing.
It's okay... it's me.
I've programmed the Transporter to    isolate any glial cells with Vantika's    neural patterns... and beam them    from Julian into this micro-   containment field...
Once they're out... Julian should be    back to normal...
I'm only reading human neural    patterns... he's clear.
I... have... the worst headache...
Doctor Bashir... I'm so sorry for    this...
I guess... we should have listened    to you when you said he was alive...
There was no way for you to control    what he was doing to you...
I'm afraid... I don't even remember    it... I feel quite... humiliated    actually...
No one blames you, Doctor.
It wasn't you... it was... that.
What do you intend to do with it?
May I assume you've returned custody    of the prisoner to me, Commander    Sisko?
The prisoner.  What's left of him.
Good.
